Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: I have to admit that as much as I like the animation in this movie and the music is wonderful. The story is kind of meh, I mean it's good and it has the spirit of the story. However, it diverges from the book with the side story of the girl (but I guess it has to since the pilot is old in this adaptation and his character is somehow related to her's now). I would have to say that Paramount's 1974 live action musical adaptation with Richard Kiley and Gene Wilder follows the book almost word for word without being boring. It is also a musical, which is interesting. The animated film has it's strengths, but I think there are aspects about the story in which it fell apart on that the 1974 film pulled off spectacularly.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
It's a lovely movie definitely which sorta captures the spirit of the book, but I personally would have preferred that they didn't have this over-arcing story about the little girl and the pilot (although it did tie in with the message of the book). But I get it, to introduce the story to the public, there needs to be a relatable premise. So, while it's not ideal, it's still a lovely movie.
Also, the part about the fox and the rose was alot more tragic in the book, but in the movie, it was resolved so easily. I guess they won't ever really capture the true essence, but will perhaps be a stepping stone for people to check out the book.

She commented suicide after she lost a dear friend and it made her in turn lose her battle with her anxiety and depression from her childhood. She will forever be my Unique Rose and because I loved a rose that was unique in all the universe I can be happy and forever remember her in the stars that laugh where her memory forever resides. I had a star named after her last year so I can always find her in the sky and feel she is there at night watching the sunsets with me.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
I watched this on a plane. 

I don't know why it happens, but it's a well-documented phenomenon that people are much more liable to cry at movies on planes. 

I was weepy a few minutes in, and sobbing uncontrollably for pretty much half the film. I mean audible embarrassing ugly crying. I've never cried so hard at a movie in my life.

This is a gorgeous film, and a daring, magical adaptation of one of the most wonderful children's books out there.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: So I have been looking for an appropriate place to ask a question about this movie, as a soon-to-be-mother, im pregnant and enjoy watching children's movies but now with the perspective of some one who will have a child, I am wondering about the hidden messages in this movie? I didn't even watch it all the way because frankly I was turned off, and need some advise from parent who have watched this...but does anyone not see a problem with an old man from next door luring a little girl away from her studies to play make believe with him in his house all day? And then she hides the relationship from her mother...I just found this all very disconcerting...and how do we explain to our children not to play or run off with strangers and yet it's fine for the girl in the story to do it and not even be honest with her mother? No bashing please, just want to hear from other parents. Thanks

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: I would just like to say that this is one of the first animated films that I've seen in a very, very long time that has managed to make me cry.  As a fan of the original book, I can say that this film did it justice and then some with its own special interpretation of the themes intended.  This is everything that The Lorax movie failed to be in terms of adapting a simple short story into a feature animated film, while still holding onto what made the original source material special and unique.  Well done.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: There is no possible way that I can describe how beautiful this film was. Not only is the animation a work of art, the dialogue itself is unlike anything I've ever heard. When I watched this film, a simple conversation between the pilot and the little prince made me bawl my eyes out. This film does not only provide young and old viewers with life-long lessons, it also is probably the most beautiful and raw representation of what love, friendship, and growing up really means. Also one of the most quotable movies ever: "It is the time wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important." Sorry for the novel of a comment; but honestly, this film deserves it.

Comment: The most profound part of this movie is when the prince speaks about how stars are beautiful because of a flower that can't be seen and that a desert is wonderful because of a hidden well. Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: This movie becomes more amazing after reading Healing the Wounded God by Jeffrey Raff and The Red Book by Carl Jung. The kid in this movie correlates to the Ally in Raffs book. This is actually a very complicated story about how to integrate the different aspects of the psyche in order to access your full potential to become your true self beyond mortality. This movie is not a kids movie at all.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
I saw this movie at an early screening with my French class (it was the English version), and aside from some awkward dialogue (such as a child saying "how can this be" which is a bit strange sounding out loud), the movie was *phenomenal.* I'm not going to give any spoilers, but there was some tears shed!
All in all, if you get the chance, *please* go see this movie. The combination of CGI and stop motion animation made the whole thing feel so immersive, like you were part of the story. It's a very powerful message about not forgetting to have fun once in a while, and not becoming someone with a gray life and a gray attitude (unless thats your thing, in which case, um???).
But I loved this movie. Please go see it.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
When I first heard of the The little prince in when i was in highshool. I am now a Part- student in college while working in a retail store. I was stocking some items and i came across the electronic section of the store and it played a trailer of the little prince and i was in shocked of the footage of what i saw and the contents of it. I normally I dont care about what they show like movie trailer or 'Frozen'. But as i saw it i felt a surge of Nostalgia  of childhood and memories I forgotten. I teared up as they show the trailer. As I remember Playing cops and robbers, Sleep overs, Watching the stars and just being carefree. Then It started to move my memories to how of being Just a Kid to a Young Adult.
Growing up is Scary but its something we can push thru and I'm uncertain how my life is going to turn out. But i can;t be scared anymore i have to put a brave face and Walk into it.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: The quote is talking about the inability of most adults to be able to believe in things that they cannot see with their eyes. By the time we have reached adulthood, we have lost that child-like quality that allows us to imagine what can't be proven. As adults, we see only the outward appearances of people and things. We no longer see a person's inner beauty, for example, or appreciate the beautiful things in nature. As adults, we have become cynical and have lost our child-like innocence. We concern ourselves with the daily, "serious" subjects of life, such as paying bills, getting a better job, or buying a bigger, better car. The love we feel for other people in our lives is not something we can see, but we know that it's there because we feel it within our hearts. The differences between our childhood and our adulthood are vast. As a child, we use our imaginations and feel wonder at such small things that most of us as adults don't see anymore. The child can see the magic in the world and believe in it.¬†Unfortunately,¬†most of us¬†lose that by the time we have become¬†adults.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
i've only ever heard of the book, but i was close to tears on this trailer. the entire two and a half minutes shows that there's not only love an effort put in the movie, but from the source material. the issue that's presented, a parent who has their kid's entire damn future ahead of them, with no time for any fun, art, or anything that wont cause hernia inducing stress is not only a very relevant issue, but one that needs to be addressed and talked about. the switching between different animation styles doesn't seem like a gimmick either, and that isnt something a lazy cash cow would throw in, that really seems like an artistic choice that someone who was willing to put in the effort to make a good movie on a source material they love. and my favorite part of all:
The Dude himself, Jeff Bridges!!
(but no really this looks like itll be such a great movie and im looking forward to it)

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: I think my heart stopped for a moment when I saw the title and the trailer. The only reason why I know of this title is because of a former SKE48 member named Rena Matsui. She's also my all time, timeless, graduated oshimen. She used to say that this was her favorite book of all time and later on quoted from it in her photobook :3 ^^ When I saw this title and went through the trailer I'm like, "OH MY GOSH!! O.O They're making Rena's favorite book into a movie :3" I've only read the book before because I was a fan of her's and I got curious as to what the story was about. And now that they're making a movie I am just stunned and in awe.. Rena-chan!!! If you happen to see this I hope you're even more excited than I am (VERY VERY EXCITED) about this upcoming movie!!! In any case, it seems rather justifying that Rena-chan would be attending the premiere of this movie when it gets released in Japan. I will absolutely be anticipating these unfolding of events!! ^^

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
I'm just crying at the animation, imagine all the hard work they put in this, all the animators that wanted to make it perfect, all the writers that knew they should follow the book, the story that fit perfectly and made it wondrous.
I was terrified when I heard they were making another The Little Prince movie, since the multiple adaptions before it were not perfect as they went on their own accord, although still beautiful. But as soon as the Little Prince asked for a sheep, I knew that they were doing it right.
- Me

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: I love The Little Prince with all my heart, living in the country that inspired the story in the first place (El Salvador, where Saint-Exupery met his wife), and I am almost on the verge of tears knowing that a new movie adaptation is coming out (the last one was a film made I think in the 60s or 70s, it was a musical take on it, hardly remembered these days, but if you were lucky enough to have seen it, you'd know how great and heartwarming a movie it is), and a new modern take on it, no less. I am going to be very open minded with this idea, so I'll definitely give this movie a shot, however I still wish to make note of my concerns, especially with the whole idea of The Little Prince being more of a substory in the main story of The Little Girl, but I am loving the mix between Pixar-Dreamworks looking animation mixed with stopmotion, so I'm sure the core classic will be treated with respect, and the voicecast is awesome too! I have a couple of more concerns, but that's for another time. In the meantime, I'm really looking forward to the day this comes out everywhere, especially here in El Salvador, the Little Country :P

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment:
Previous film adaptations of this book have been done, but always faced difficulty in transferring the same feelings that the book gave off. So when I saw how it was done here, I thought that, though different, actually brings in the meaning in a more effective way than just retelling the story; in this case, giving the same perspective that we had with this story.
In this way, the messages and ideals that were given can be retold in a more "modern" setting while keeping consistency to what made the story a timeless, non-outdated classic
(Unlike some recent films like The Lorax that try to be "hip" with a mainstream audience and ignore subtleties of the original source)

Comment: One night, I was rummaging through my attic, not looking for anything in particular, when I found a little, turquoise, hardcover book called "The Little Prince." I opened it just to skim the story, and I ended staying up there all night, until I had finished reading it to the very last page. It's a wonderful story with a kind and timeless feel to it. Upon seeing this trailer, I have hope that the film will meet the same level of childish wonder.

Title: The Little Prince Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Marion Cotillard, Jeff Bridges Animated Movie HD
Comment: Another reminiscent animation for the imagination.. Looks like it'll be a new classic with the heart warming feelers. Just saying there's a very high chance the old guy dies in the end or near and his last words may be something like 'you're going to make a wonderful grown up' which sounded choked up in the last second of the trailer.. Nonetheless, 'looks great' should be the lowest compliment. It seems like he's giving the message to keep your dreams and imagination, build upon it even while having such a sophisticated/uptight lifestyle especially at her age. For example: her mother setting her up to be an adult already, the old guy basically being her guide into the other side of adolescence/growing up which I think a lot of kids really lose these days with so much tech and awful interaction.. They might try and make an argument justifying that they do, but really they have no argument :c
